=== Game Rules ===
Game rules in natural language:
Overview:
• Genre: A classic arcade-style space shooter.
• Theme: You control a spaceship (avatar) in outer space, fending off waves of enemy aliens and their bombs. The visual style is retro with space backgrounds and planet bases.

Game Elements & Mechanics:
1. Sprites & Roles:
 – The player’s avatar is a spaceship (sprite "avatar") armed with a projectile (called "sam", a blue bullet shot upward). This is the main means for attacking enemies.
 – Enemy aliens appear in two variants (alienBlue and alienGreen) and are spawned via invisible portals (portalSlow and portalFast). These aliens exhibit bomber behavior: they may drop bombs ("bomb", red and slowly descending) as they approach.
 – The "base" (a white planet image) is an immovable object that plays a significant role. Certain collisions with the base have unique consequences:
  • A bomb hitting the base kills both the bomb and the base.
  • A collision between the base and your "sam" bullet also kills both, but adds a small score bonus.
  • When an alien touches the base, the alien is destroyed.
 – Other sprites like "missile" and additional elements provide mechanisms for projectile collisions (e.g., missiles kill sprites on impact with the edge, EOS).

2. Interactions & Collisions:
 – Your avatar bounces off the stage boundaries (EOS interaction) to avoid leaving play.
 – Enemies, when reaching the edge, turn around and continue their approach.
 – When your sam projectile collides with an alien, the alien is destroyed and you gain score (+2), but if your ship collides with an alien or a bomb, the enemy is neutralized and you lose score (–1).
 – Some interactions (base with bomb or sam) result in both involved sprites being eliminated, affecting both defenses and scoring.

3. Objectives & Win/Loss Conditions:
 – The primary goal is to survive with your avatar. If your avatar is destroyed (SpriteCounter for avatar reaches 0), you lose.
 – You win once you have eliminated all enemy aliens and their spawn points (portals). The win condition is checked via a counter that monitors the presence of both portals and aliens; when there are none left (limit=0), you win.

Overall Game Strategy:
• Stay mobile – keep your avatar moving, as you not only need to avoid enemy collisions and downward-falling bombs but also use the momentum to position yourself for well-timed shots.
• Prioritize targets – the most dangerous foes are the aliens emerging from portals. Use your upward-shooting “sam” projectiles to hit aliens from a safe distance; each hit scores you points.
• Dodge and maneuver – since collisions with aliens or bombs will cost you (and may even endanger your base), continuous evasive maneuvers are crucial.
• Manage the spawn threat – with two types of portals spawning aliens at different cooldowns, keep an eye on the screen. Try to eliminate aliens promptly before they have the chance to drop bombs or swarm your position.
• Be mindful of your base – while interactions with your base can sometimes yield a score bonus (e.g., when a sam projectile hits it), the base can be a double-edged sword. Its survival might provide tactical cover or another layer of defense, so avoid unnecessary collisions (especially from bombs) that would neutralize it.

In plain language:
You’re piloting a spaceship in a retro space shooter. Your job is to dodge enemy attacks and shoot down the incoming aliens that emerge from hidden spawn points (portals). Score points by eliminating aliens with your blue bullet (sam) while carefully avoiding collisions with enemy bombs or the aliens themselves. If you lose your ship, you lose the game, but if you manage to clear the screen of enemy aliens and their portals, you win! Stay agile, prioritize threats, and work on controlling the battlefield as enemy bombs descend slowly and aliens keep coming.

This clear focus on survival, dodging, and precise shooting, along with efficiently managing spawn threats, forms the heart of your strategy.

You are an intelligent player playing a video game, and you have a friend provide you strategy. Interpret the state, rule, strategy and act accordingly. Notice that your avatar position is one of the most important information, if the position doesn't change from the last state, you need to analyze the state and make a different action from the last time.

=== Available Actions ===
0: ACTION_NIL
1: ACTION_USE
2: ACTION_LEFT
3: ACTION_RIGHT

=== Important Mechanics Notice ===
 In some games, directional actions (LEFT, RIGHT, UP, DOWN) may first cause the avatar to rotate toward the intended direction without immediately moving. If the avatar's position does not change after a directional action, it may indicate a rotation has occurred. To proceed, you must apply the directional action again after rotation. Always verify whether the avatar actually moved after each action. Please understand the rule and the interaction set first, then locate the item, finally choose a meaningful action towards the win and respond in the format: ``` Action:<action number> ```. Include one sentence of feedback on the action and your expectation to see if it aligns with the strategy. Notice, Action 0 will not reasult in any change in this game environment, and you may need to understand the level layout first to play the game.

background portalSlow -> '1'
background portalFast -> '2'
alienGreen -> '@'
base -> '#'
sam -> '$'
alienGreen bomb -> '%'
bomb -> '&'
bomb sam -> '*'
